results.title: Heaven's My Destination
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Everyman”.
Since returning from the moon many astronauts have testified to the strong spiritual impact the space experience has had on them. A number have committed themselves to Christ and Ed Mitchell has founded the Institute of Noetic Sciences. This program looks at how space travel has given these men a new perception of man’s place in the universe.

results.title: Prisoners of Conscience
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Everyman”.
The case histories of Gustavo Westerkamp and Danylo Shumuk who were imprisoned for their religious and political beliefs are examined and the work of Amnesty International

results.title: The Seventh Enemy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Everyman”.
Based on the book of the same title the six elements in the global crisis are explained: The population explosion, starvation, disappearing natural resources, degradation of the environment, nuclear weapons and the power of science and technology. The real danger is the seventh enemy - the human factor of apathy and inertia which could result in a universal war between poor and rich nations

results.title: Desperate voyage
results.creator_credit: Christine Fox and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Everyman”.
Documents Operation “Sea Sweep” (Singapore, July 1979) attempting to give aid and assistance to the ‘boat people’, helping them safely to land, supplying petrol and medical aid. Operation “Sea Sweep” battle politics to keep the ship registered and operating.

group_works.title: Equal chances: equal opportunities
group_works.creator_credit: Jean Leduc and Les Films d'Olivier

results.title: Equal chances: equal opportunities
results.creator_credit: Jean Leduc and Les Films d'Olivier
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “European Community”.
Deals with the notion of equal work for equal pay. Shows examples of women employed in non-traditional jobs. Encourages girls to look at all areas of employment and suggests that equality of job opportunity should begin at school.

results.title: Noise: polluting the environment
results.creator_credit: Thomas Smith and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Environment in Crisis”.
A study of noise pollution as exemplified by the problems emanating from traffic noises and the noise of aircraft in residential areas. Although made in 1971, the issue of noise pollution is even more significant in 2002.

results.title: Controversy over industrial pollution: a case study
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Luther Gerlach
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Environment in Crisis”.
Anaconda Aluminium Company opened a plant at Columbia Falls, Montana. In 1968, after a plant explosion, poisonous fluoride emissions began to damage trees for miles around. All sides of the resulting controversy are presented objectively in this film,which should spark discussion of the environmental crisis in general and of the scientific, social and economic issues involved in finding solutions to pollution problems
